name: Wind Release: Great Breakthrough
summary: Expels a powerful gust of wind that can knock back targets and fan flames.
technique: Gather wind-nature chakra in the lungs and throat.
Shape the release into a wide, forceful cone.
Exhale in a steady surge; adjust head tilt to control elevation.
training: Paper flag drill: keep a line of flags horizontal for 3 seconds.
Cone control: maintain a 45° spread without side eddies.
Pair with candles to practice precise airflow without extinguishing.
tips: Amplifies existing fire—coordinate with Katon users.
Best for crowd control and clearing smoke or mist.

markdown.text: A broad gust that knocks enemies back and manipulates battlefield airflow.

name: Wind Release: Vacuum Bullets
summary: Fires multiple high-pressure wind bullets capable of puncturing targets at range.
technique: Compress wind-nature chakra into tight, rotating spheres.
Tap rhythmically with tongue/cheek to sequence shots.
training: Metronome drill at 120 BPM to time consistent salvos.
Paper target array at staggered depths; log penetration.
Breath economy—limit chest movement to reduce recoil.
tips: Best from cover; minimal visual tell beyond muzzle distortion.
Pairs with shadow binding to fix targets in place.

markdown.text: Rapid-fire wind projectiles that puncture with rotational pressure.

name: Wind Release: Rasenshuriken
summary: An advanced Rasengan variant infused with Wind Release that creates a massive shuriken of microscopic blades.
technique: Form a stable Rasengan with external clone assistance or perfected control.
Imbue wind-nature chakra, creating peripheral blade arms.
Throw or detonate in hand; maintain cohesion to the point of impact.
training: Rotation and compression mastery with clone feedback.
Wind nature transformation drills on small spheres.
Distance practice to ensure safe detonation away from allies.
tips: Causes cellular-level damage; avoid friendly proximity.
High stamina and recovery window required after use.

markdown.text: A wind-augmented Rasengan forming a giant shuriken that tears targets at a microscopic level.
